text:
- [Narrator] Today, machine
learning practitioners

don't have a tool to document
and audit their models
in one centralized place,

making it hard to
achieve model governance.
And with growing ML adoption,
to gain end-to-end transparency,

companies often need to
build the tools themselves
or lean on disparate manual ones,
which makes approving, auditing,
and monitoring models difficult.
Meet Amazon SageMaker's Model Cards
and Amazon SageMaker Model Dashboard,
two new capabilities designed to provide

end-to-end visibility across
your ML model's lifecycle.
Now, when developing a new model,
SageMaker Model Cards self-populates

with training details
and model information,
then it takes the user
through a series of self-guided prompts.

This helps standardize model
documentation from the start

with intended uses,
artifacts, expected behaviors,

and evaluation observations
just at your fingertips.
Want to share your Model Card?

Exporting a PDF is as
simple as a few clicks.
Once deployed, SageMaker's Model Dashboard

creates a unified view
across all your models,
allowing users to audit performance
for bias, drift, and more.

Plus, automated built-in
alerts let you know
when models aren't being monitored
or deviate from expected behaviors.
And this experience is integrated
into Amazon SageMaker's existing features,
which help save time and resources.

Improve governance and
gain end-to-end visibility

with SageMaker's Model
Cards and Model Dashboard.
Get started today.
